answers.answer: I've been on these types of medications for 20+ years and my memory is just fine.  I wouldn't worry about the "what ifs" all they do is scare you.  But if you haven't given therapy a chance I definietely would do that.  Often our anxiety/depression can have a root cause...normally something traumatic from our past which we may have never truly dealt with and even forgotten about.  It comes back demanding to be dealt with in the form of anxiety and/or depression.  If yours has a root cause, by getting into therapy you can learn what this is, deal with it and maybe not need the medications.  It's always wise to at least try therapy, we can learn a lot about ourselves and how to cope better.... at the very least.  Often anxiety is like any other medical condition....like diabetes which requires daily medications to control the symptoms...and that's okay.  You've been on your medications just long enough to really benefit from them, and I'm happy to hear that they are working so well.  Know that our bodies do build up a tolerance to these types of medications and eventually you will need to switch to a new one, this is normal and you will know when the time has come if you start to feel bad again. I hope this helps and take care!
